title: How to Fix an Xbox 360 Error E68

steps.headline: Turn the Xbox 360 off and disconnect the power cord.
Remove the HDD (if present).
steps.description: To remove the HDD from  an "old" Xbox 360, press the button on the HDD and remove the HDD. To remove the HDD from a "Slim" Xbox 360, open the HDD door and pull the HDD out of the console. If there is no HDD installed in your console, go to the step 8

steps.headline: Reconnect the power cord and turn the Xbox 360 on
Is your Xbox 360 now operating normally?
steps.description: If it is, turn the Xbox 360 off and go to next step. If the red light flashes again, go to the step 8.

steps.headline: Place the HDD back in place
Does the red light flash again?
steps.description: If it does, your HDD is defective and  should be replaced. If the console is now operating normally, the HDD was loose. You can now enjoy gaming.

steps.headline: If the console is not operating even without the HDD in place, one of connected accessories may be defective.
steps.description: Follow the next steps to check the accessories.

steps.headline: Unplug all USB-devices (such as thumb drives, cooling fans, battery chargers, controllers) and memory units
If the console is now operating normally, one of the accessories is damaged or was connected loose.
steps.description: Turn the Xbox 360 off and reconnect one of the accessories then turn the Xbox 360 on. Repeat this with all other accessories. If the Xbox 360 operates normally after reconnecting all accessories, one of them was connected loose. You can enjoy gaming.

steps.headline: If your Xbox 360 is showing E68 error even without HDD and accessories connected, it is defective.

tyn: Another device that can browse the Internet(optional)
Lots of money(if one ring on Original Console)
text: Turn the Xbox 360 off and disconnect the power cord.  Remove the HDD (if present). To remove the HDD from  an "old" Xbox 360, press the button on the HDD and remove the HDD. To remove the HDD from a "Slim" Xbox 360, open the HDD door and pull the HDD out of the console. If there is no HDD installed in your console, go to the step 8 Reconnect the power cord and turn the Xbox 360 on  Is your Xbox 360 now operating normally? If it is, turn the Xbox 360 off and go to next step. If the red light flashes again, go to the step 8. Place the HDD back in place  Turn the Xbox 360 on  Does the red light flash again? If it does, your HDD is defective and  should be replaced. If the console is now operating normally, the HDD was loose. You can now enjoy gaming. If the console is not operating even without the HDD in place, one of connected accessories may be defective. Follow the next steps to check the accessories. Turn the Xbox 360 off.  Unplug all USB-devices (such as thumb drives, cooling fans, battery chargers, controllers) and memory units  Turn the Xbox 360 on  If the console is now operating normally, one of the accessories is damaged or was connected loose. Turn the Xbox 360 off and reconnect one of the accessories then turn the Xbox 360 on. Repeat this with all other accessories. If the Xbox 360 operates normally after reconnecting all accessories, one of them was connected loose. You can enjoy gaming. If your Xbox 360 is showing E68 error even without HDD and accessories connected, it is defective.
sentences: Turn the Xbox 360 off and disconnect the power cord.
Remove the HDD (if present).
To remove the HDD from  an "old" Xbox 360, press the button on the HDD and remove the HDD.
To remove the HDD from a "Slim" Xbox 360, open the HDD door and pull the HDD out of the console.
If there is no HDD installed in your console, go to the step 8 Reconnect the power cord and turn the Xbox 360 on  Is your Xbox 360 now operating normally?
If it is, turn the Xbox 360 off and go to next step.
If the red light flashes again, go to the step 8.
Place the HDD back in place  Turn the Xbox 360 on  Does the red light flash again?
If it does, your HDD is defective and  should be replaced.
If the console is now operating normally, the HDD was loose.
You can now enjoy gaming.
If the console is not operating even without the HDD in place, one of connected accessories may be defective.
Follow the next steps to check the accessories.
Turn the Xbox 360 off.

Unplug all USB-devices (such as thumb drives, cooling fans, battery chargers, controllers) and memory units  Turn the Xbox 360 on  If the console is now operating normally, one of the accessories is damaged or was connected loose.
Turn the Xbox 360 off and reconnect one of the accessories then turn the Xbox 360 on.
Repeat this with all other accessories.
If the Xbox 360 operates normally after reconnecting all accessories, one of them was connected loose.
You can enjoy gaming.
If your Xbox 360 is showing E68 error even without HDD and accessories connected, it is defective.
